task.title: Searching the full text
task.shortdesc: The search box is autocomplete-enabled. If you don't use that function (e.g. you continue to type your word or phrase without selecting a term from the drop down list) your search may not work if it has a spelling error or extra space.

context.p: If you have selected a chapter from the Table of Contents then your search will only be conducted within that chapter. If you would like to conduct a full text search make sure that none of the chapters/sections are selected.

step.cmd: Type in the word(s) that you are searching for.
DToC displays the location of the word you are looking for in the table of content and document model.
To restart your search choose the “Clear” button located at the top of the document model.

link.linktext: Overview of Dynamic Table of Context
link.desc: The Dynamic Table of Context (DToC) lets users reveal information about their text that is not necessarily discovered when reading, such as word frequencies. DToC also allows users to customize their document with annotations and adding tags.
The Table of Contents shows the section or chapter breakdown of your document. The ToC will expand to display the information selected from the left column.

link.linktext: Left column of Dynamic Table of Context
link.desc: This column allow users to search and browse the document by key terms, tags, and word frequency information.

link.linktext: Navigating text in the table of contents
link.desc: The Table of Contents displays terms selected (from the left column) and lets users move through the text by clicking on them. This allows for in-depth exploration of terms without scrolling through large chunks of text.
The Document Model is a deconstructed version of your document. Each section of grey lines represents a different section/chapter/article within the document.

The text is separated into chapters, sections, or articles by the XML document. The text area loads individual sections, so the whole document will not appear unless there are no text divisions in the document.

link.linktext: Filtering index terms, tags, and stats
link.desc: The search feature narrows down terms automatically as you type, whether they have the specific combination of letters you are typing anywhere in the word (not just if the word starts with the letters you are typing).

When you move between different tabs in the left column they will not be filtered by the Chapter you have selected in the previous column. However, when you return to the initial tab, the chapter filter will remain selected.
You can customize how you view word frequencies in DToC by different organizational headings and by how the words are displayed under those headings.

link.linktext: Viewing stats by chapters and collections

link.desc: You can add as many terms as you would like to your “Favorites” list, either all at once or a few at a time.
